forecast-period.text: A trough extends from the central Gascoyne and across the North Interior.

A surface trough stretches from the Central West coast, across the southern Gascoyne and into the Interior of the State with a ridge of high pressure well south of the State. The trough near the west coast will move eastwards during Monday afternoon. A ridge of high pressure will develop near the southwest of the State on Tuesday.
For latest warnings go to www.bom.gov.au, subscribe to RSS feeds, call 1300-659-213* or listen for warnings on relevant TV and radio broadcasts.
* Calls to 1300 numbers cost around 27.5c incl. GST, higher from mobiles or public phones.

Showers and thunderstorms over the Kimberley, Interior, Goldfields and the Eucla. Showers over the South West Land Division with thunderstorms clearing eastern parts during the morning. Showers over the west Gascoyne and west Pilbara. Thunderstorms developing over the inland Gascoyne and west Pilbara during the evening. Moderate to heavy falls possible in the South East Coastal, Goldfields, Eucla, and South Interior.

Showers and thunderstorms over the Kimberley, Interior, Goldfields, western Eucla and over the South West Land Division south of Jurien Bay. Showers in the west Gascoyne, and near the western Pilbara coast.

Showers and thunderstorms over the Kimberley, Gascoyne, west Pilbara, Interior, Eucla, northern parts of the South West Land Division, and Goldfields. Showers in the southern and central parts of the South West Land Division.
Showers and thunderstorms over the Kimberley, Interior, east Pilbara and east Gascoyne. Showers over southern and central parts of the South West Land Division, the southern Goldfields and the Eucla.
Showers and thunderstorms over the Kimberley, Interior, Pilbara, east Gascoyne, Goldfields, Eucla, and the South West Land Division.
